title: How is the 2021 CBSE board exam expected to be? - Quora
tags: All India Senior School Certificate Examination
Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Hi, The curiosity is obvious. Though due to this COVID-19 outbreak, the situation after this will not be the same now, many things and system are gonna be changed in our day to day life and in the world, many technological advancements will take place and also many existing systems and processes will be discontinued. Now coming to the point, CBSE is a totally independent body within itself. It can implement and discontinue its own decision at any time. Like for example : CCE pattern was discontinued.CBSE class 10th exam 2020 was supposed to be held after this lock down but it has been cancelled nationwide.For class 12th exam 2020 only the examination for major subjects will be taken.Delhi students will only be giving the exams and not whole India.etc. are many things which are declared at a sudden. Though there are lot of factors discussed before announcing any rule & regarding welfare of the students. So it will be totally a useless thing to predict that what will CBSE do in 2021. Yes, its true that some changes in the pattern and system might be introduced but there is still time. And no matter, whatever will be the decision one will have to abide by those. So, lets not worry about this better focus on the target….and one should always be mentally prepared to deal with any type of situation/challenges that’s how you develop a self esteem within yourself. Edit 1: Looking at the present situation CBSE has already decreased the syllabus and classes are also being conducted online. Also even after all the chaos nationwide govt. still conducted NEET (pen & paper based) and JEE as well taking all the possible measures and arrangements. So better keep preparing, in whatever way the board exams will be conducted you will anyway have to appear for it. Hope this helps… “Live life king size” Thank you!!! Good Luck & All the Best :) Feel free to connect…

I think no one can answer this question with certainty. You cannot expect the CBSE Board papers to be easy or tough as most of the times it has happened that when the students expect the paper to be easy it turned out to be a nightmare and vice versa. Thus mostly it has happened that CBSE has surprised the students with their variations in conduct of examination. And the same goes for the 2021 CBSE Board exam. However, you can take your exam preparation to the next level with the help of online courses from Bright Tutee and be ready for any surprise. if you want to sample of application-letter and essay on festivals, famous events and famous personality so you see on below youtube channel. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwIBIZNasQbUQ5h8OPEfjjw also link on - #acheiversfactory Bright Tutee is a budding online educational platform which is providing all its courses for free amid the lockdown period. The courses have been designed as per the NCERT guidelines and CBSE syllabus. They include detailed and engaging video lessons, assignments, MCQS and more. The assignments and the MCQS help you determine how much you have learned from a given lesson. Online tests are also, which let you know what needs to be revised. You also get all the sample papers, previous years’ papers, guess papers etc for practice in the form of an exam preparation kit. With the help of this kit you get familiar with exam pattern and marking scheme of papers and you become more confident of your preparation. Bright Tutee also give you the option of customizes courses so that you can select the chapters you want to study and no need to take the whole courses. The courses are available for different time periods like one week, one month, one year etc. And the best part is you will get all this for free under the free learning offer of Bright Tutee for the whole lockdown period.

It seems to be an interesting question but.. You are asking something which no one can answer. 😂😂 CBSE is tough to predict they have a habit to surprise students with their variations in conduct of examination. Let me tell you the previous year analysis. 2015 : Mathematics was a nightmare to the students. In 2016 mathematics was expected to be the easiest paper but it was even more tougher than 2015. So in 2016 cbse again gave shock to all the students. In 2017 when everyone was expecting mathematics to be the toughest, It tourned out to be the easiest. Every Question was from NCERT not even a single Question was outside NCERT. Again CBSE left the students in Surprise. Then comes 2020 physics paper it was expected that physics exam will be easier than earlier since there was a change in paper pattern. Everyone was expecting easy paper but it's old habit of CBSE to show🖕to the students expectations and again 2020 physics exam tourned out to be a nightmare for the students. 😂 I won't give you false hope but don't keep any expectations from CBSE. Cbse might surprise you too so its better to be prepared for the worst case scenario.🙂 One last suggestion at the end : Practice like you never won And Perform like you never lost. 🙂

Though due to this COVID-19 outbreak, the situation after this will not be the same now, many things and system are gonna be changed in our day to day life and in the world, many technological advancements will take place and also many existing systems and processes will be discontinued. Now coming to the point, CBSE is a totally independent body within itself. It can implement and discontinue its own decision at any time. Like for example : CCE pattern was discontinued. CBSE class 10th exam 2020 was supposed to be held after this lock down but it has been cancelled nationwide. For class 12th exam 2020 only the examination for major subjects will be taken. Delhi students will only be giving the exams and not whole India. etc. are many things which are declared at a sudden. Though there are lot of factors discussed before announcing any rule & regarding welfare of the students. So it will be totally a useless thing to predict that what will CBSE do in 2021. Yes, its true that some changes in the pattern and system might be introduced but there is still time. And no matter, whatever will be the decision one will have to abide by those. You can join “Toppr : The Better Learning App” for better preparation for CBSE Board exam.

The board examination (2021) is full of uncertainties. CBSE has already reduced the syllabus by 30% and is likely to reduce more of it. The curiosity arises naturally about the standard of the board examination in these challenging time. The paper is likely to be of a moderate level. The sample papers were released a couple of days back. According to the new pattern and marking scheme more 3 marks questions are coming than long 5 marks questions. Students have to be precise. The sample paper was not so easy, however it was a mix of standards. For eg. The mathematics standard paper had 4 case study questions which were introduced in this session. Study accordingly, it will be all fine😃. You still have some time left. Best wishes. Students best of luck👍, and stay safe and hope for the best 🙌

Case 1 CBSE 2021 February-March exam will be on time, and in same manner as in 2020 (i.e. pen and paper mode), however syllabus may be reduced by 5% (may be 10%) Case 2 CBSE 2021 February-March exam may be pushed further by 30–45 days, and in same manner as in 2020 (i.e. pen and paper mode), but Syllabus remains same. Note, both the above cases are assumptions only, final decision will come from CBSE.

As we can see Corona Virus cases increase daily , so this Pandemic will supposed to end nearly October month completely . CBSE have three options : They Reduce the syllabus to 30 % if they want exam in February 2021Or they took CBSE exams in May 2020But it is difficult for CBSE to took CBSE exams in May so they have to reduce syllabus.
